channel.title: Custom programming language
channel.description:
I was just curious of what features people would add/look for in a new language. By which I mean stuff like:
[ul][li]syntax (flow, simplicity, etc.)[/li] [li]OS (in)dependant[/li] [li]OOP[/li] [li]speed[/li] [li]functions[/li] [li]what not[/li][/ul]
So just whatever you think is necessary for you to approve of a language. I'm planning on rewriting one of my interpreters in Python or Java. I'd rather do Python, but Java would be a worthy challenge.
Thanks, -Holic

I’ll take it into consideration.

-Holic[/quote]
Template-only…

item.title: Custom programming language
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=248667.msg2091195#msg2091195 date=1204795661]

Make it so simple even a caveman could do it.
And at the same time very very powerful.

If that was an easy task, wouldn’t all programming languages be like this?
[/quote]

did he say it was simple?[/quote]
It’s easy to make a basic programming language, a good programming language is a different story.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom programming language
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Zach1188:

If that was an easy task, wouldn’t all programming languages be like this?

Take a look at Python and Ruby.
Very easy syntax, although Ruby can be a bit weird sometimes, and still powerful. Hell, NASA uses Python

-Holic

Read full topic

item.title: Custom programming language
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

add a beatiful ‘standard library’, along with OOP (operator overloading, polymorphism, etc.)

edit:
and when you get far enough to having to debug code, add a buffer for the programs memory that will be shown at the end to help with debugging

item.title: Custom programming language
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Right well,
Curly braces are a must, as well as classes/main methods, no

print "Hello World"

As a hello world. In my pathetic attempt at making my own language (in C#.net) I had something like this:

@SCRIPT HelloWorld
{
    @METHOD Main()
    {
        Std::Print("Hello World");
    }
}

I know it sucks.
One thing I’d really like, is the ‘::’, ‘->’ operators that exist in C++, but not C#/Java etc. I like to know the difference between my static functions, member functions, and namespaces. Statement terminators are great too, (’;’).
Well, that’s my opinion.

Read full topic
